data.title: Songs In The Dark by The Wainwright Sisters reviews
data.meta_description: Reviews of Songs In The Dark by The Wainwright Sisters, An album of folk lullabies from half sisters Martha Wainwright and Lucy Wainwright Roche
data.text:
Any decent music? We review the reviews. You get the final word

Hello

Here's how it works: The Recent Releases chart brings together critical reaction to new albums from more than 50 sources worldwide. It's updated daily. Albums qualify with 5 reviews, and drop out after 6 weeks into the longer timespan charts.

Source list

Go to:

Specialist Genres

Browse specific styles

Choose a genre:

Search

The Wainwright Sisters

Songs In The Dark

An album of folk lullabies from half sisters Martha Wainwright and Lucy Wainwright Roche

ADM rating[?]

7.0

Label

MapleMusic Recordings / Fontana North

UK Release date

13/11/2015

US Release date

13/11/2015

Related Links

Share

8.0 81887

8.0 | Exclaim

The melodies might be for rocking infants to sleep, but the lyrics are full of the fears and stresses of that tend to crop up after midnight

Read Review

8.0 81888

8.0 | musicOMH

It’s the black humour and obvious love for the material that lifts this into another sphere

Read Review

8.0 81885

8.0 | All Music

The songs are wrapped up in gorgeous harmonies from Martha and Lucy, and the arrangements and production are spare and all the more effective for it

Read Review

8.0 81891

8.0 | The Independent

It’s a wonderful collection, with even Richard Thompson’s cold-comfort message in “End Of The Rainbow” imbued with a warm glow

Read Review

8.0 82057

8.0 | The Line Of Best Fit

As an indicator of the kind of music the Wainwrights indulged in at home while they and their many and various offspring went on to charm and dazzle the musical world, this is an invaluable document

Read Review

7.0 82362

7.0 | PopMatters

Songs in the Dark reach back to the roots of traditional music for kids when it was sung as much to provide solace for the parents as well as to entertain the kids

Read Review

7.0 81889

7.0 | Uncut

There's a lack of biting vocal interaction between the half-sisters, nothing to match the delectable harmonies that graced the McGarrigles. Print edition only

6.0 81890

6.0 | Mojo

Drenched in familiar swathes of charm, pathos, elegance and black humour. Print edition only

6.0 82046

6.0 | Q

Some of it is beautiful. Print edition only

6.0 81886

6.0 | The Music

A celebration of singalongs and lullabies that permeated through the women's childhoods

Read Review

6.0 82174

6.0 | NOW

A powerful, pining take on Andean folk tune El Cóndor Pasa stands above the rest, doomy and defiant

Read Review
